Pre-Game Insights: The Washington Nationals visit the New York Mets looking to break a three-game road skid.
New York has a 42-34 record at home and an 83-68 record overall.
Washington has gone 32-44 in road games and 68-83 overall.
The Nationals have a 51-12 record in games when they have more hits than their opponents.
The matchup is the 13th time these teams meet this season with the Mets holding a 10-2 advantage in the season series.
